text1:
An anti-shield missile intended for use at medium and large ranges of engagement, it utilises a 'hyper-brittle' warhead which has good effect on shields, but shatters ineffectively against armour plating.
 
Development on this weapon was abandoned by the Domain, but was later continued in secret by the Hegemony which, owing to a paucity of hulls capable of fielding the weapon, chose to kept the weapon classified. In of COMSEC's most embarrassing failures, the blueprints were subsequently stolen by Pirates, and the weapon has since found itself in use by The Sindrian Diktat and Tri-Tachyon

A mid size laser powered by a chemical reaction giving it the anti-armor characteristics of the high intensity laser. 

Developed by the Diktat and sold to the League for crucial scientific knowledge, it is mainly intended for use on cruisers such as the Eagle or the Falcon which can supplement it with ballistic weapons to bring down the shields of their enemies

A Long-Range-Missile. While less powerful than the Pilum, it appeals with a slightly higher speed, better anti-shield performance and the ability to mitigate or avoid many PD weapons.

Cooked up by rogue scientists in the employ of Kanta. It utilizes parts and subsystems out of the data banks of Kanta's den and out of data hashes in the treasures of warlord Loke. Through the many skirmishes in the Magec the Tri-Tachyon corporation and the Independent microfactions of the sector have also gained access to this weapon.

Heavy anti small craft support and escort craft. Mounting the Grasshopper SRM it can rip apart enemy fighters and even frigates when massed. At the same time, it lacks operational range, requires a considerable crew complement and is not very survivable for it's size

A post-collapse design of the Church of Galactic Redemption, it is the opposite of miniaturized and automated. It has still proven a effective escort for the capital ships of both the Knights of Ludds and the Luddic path

A Derivative of the Locust SRM, the Grasshopper SRM fires 16 missiles in a salvo, as opposed to the Locust's 40. While it doesn't invoke quite the same terror in fighter pilots as it's larger brother, it still commands considerable respect among them. 

A post-collapse design of the Luddic church, the Grasshopper SRM found, of course, it's way into the hands of the Luddic path, though a lack of suitable hulls has made it's deployment by them sparse, to the relief of the sectors fighter pilots

An agile fighter equipped with a modified needler firing shorter bursts than it's standard counterpart. Struggles to secure kills on its own but can exert considerable pressure on an enemy.

A Persean League design, the Stormwind utilizes the latest advancements in small-scale generator technology and modular design. As a result of this, it can be deployed in high numbers and swiftly replaced when a unit is destroyed, all while remaining surprisingly survivable.
